InteractionManager¶

class Leap::Unity::Interaction::InteractionManager

InteractionManager is the core behaviour that manages the IInteractionBehaviours in the scene.

This class allows IInteractionBehaviours to register with it and provides all of the callbacks needed for operation. This class also takes care of all bookkeeping to keep track of the objects, hands, and the internal state of the interaction plugin.

InteractionManager has the following features:

InteractionManager has the following requirements:

Public Functions

void GraspWithHand(Hand hand, IInteractionBehaviour interactionBehaviour)

Forces a hand to grasp the given interaction behaviour.

The grasp will only be terminated when the hand either times out or the user calls ReleaseHand.

Parameters
  • hand -

void RegisterInteractionBehaviour(IInteractionBehaviour interactionBehaviour)

Registers an InteractionObject with this manager, which automatically adds the objects representation into the internal interaction scene.

If the manager is disabled, the registration will still succeed and the object will be added to the internal scene when the manager is next enabled.

Trying to register a behaviour that is already registered is safe and is a no-op.

bool ReleaseHand(int handId)

Forces a hand with the given id to release an object if it is holding it.

Will return true only if a hand with the given id releases an object it was holding.

bool ReleaseObject(IInteractionBehaviour graspedObject)

Forces the given object to be released by any hands currently holding it.

Will return true only if there was at least one hand holding the object.

bool TryGetGraspedObject(int handId, out IInteractionBehaviour graspedObject)

Tries to find an InteractionObject that is currently being grasped by a Hand with the given ID.

void UnregisterInteractionBehaviour(IInteractionBehaviour interactionBehaviour)

Unregisters an InteractionObject from this manager.

This removes it from the internal scene and prevents any further interaction.

Trying to unregister a behaviour that is not registered is safe and is a no-op.

void UpdateSceneInfo()

Force an update of the internal scene info.

This should be called if gravity has changed.

class InteractionHand
